Frequently Asked Questions

Answers to common questions about If√°-Lang

üîÆ What is If√°-Lang?

If√°-Lang is a compiled, dynamically typed programming language inspired by the Yoruba divination system (If√°). It structures system design around the 16 Od√π domains (e.g., Ogbe for System, Irosu for I/O, Irete for Crypto).

‚ö° Is it fast?

Yes! If√°-Lang compiles to optimized bytecode and uses a Rust-based VM. It allows zero-cost abstractions and safe low-level control. For high-performance tasks, it supports parallel execution (Osa domain).

üåç Can I code in English?

Absolutely. If√°-Lang is bilingual. You can write keywords in Yoruba (e.g., ayanmo, ti) or English (let, if), or mix them. The compiler understands both natively.

üì¶ How do I manage packages?

We use ·ªåj√† (Market), a built-in package manager. You can install packages with ifa install <package> and publish your own to the registry.

üîí Is it memory safe?

Yes. If√°-Lang uses a hybrid resource management model called ·∫∏b·ªç (Sacrifice). Resources must be explicitly "sacrificed" (freed/consumed) or they are managed by the runtime's garbage collector/RC, ensuring safety without complexity.
